oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1949-11-26 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry Show from November 26, 1949. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host, performer), Hank Williams (performer), Jimmy Riddle (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Helen Harris (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys (performers). Transcribed from Titania-Palast, Berlin, Germany for radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Hank Williams; Jimmy Riddle; Rod Brasfield; Helen Harris; Little Jimmy Dickens; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Freight Train Boogie (Red Foley) -- Opening statement (Red Foley) -- Move It On Over (Hank Williams) -- Prince Albert commercial (Red Foley, Grant Turner) -- [Unidentified harmonica tune] (Jimmy Riddle harmonica) -- Red Foley introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Helen Harris -- He Taught Me To Yodel (Helen Harris) -- Red Foley introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Country Boy (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Red Foley) -- This World Is Not My Home (Red Foley) -- Red Foley and Grant Turner introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Rod Brasfield) -- Red Foley introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- I Saw The Light (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Every Step Of The Way (Red Foley) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Roy Acuff calls) -- Closing statement (Red Foley) -- Closing statement (Grant Turner) -- Songs By Morton Downey commercial
